Sure! Here are a few tea-blending recipes to try:

1. Chai Spice Blend: Mix 3 parts black tea with 2 parts cinnamon, 2 parts cardamom, 1 part ginger, and 1 part cloves. Add milk and honey to taste.

2. Citrus Twist Blend: Combine equal parts of green tea and dried orange peel, then add a sprinkle of dried ginger. Serve with lemon and honey if desired.

3. Floral Tea Blend: Mix 2 parts chamomile, 1 part lavender, and 1 part rose petals. Add a drizzle of honey or a few drops of rose water to taste.

4. Mango Tango Blend: Brew 1-2 teaspoons of black tea with a tablespoon of dried mango, and add a sprinkle of cinnamon or ginger. Serve hot or iced.

5. Minty Morning Blend: Mix equal parts of black tea and peppermint leaves, and add a pinch of cinnamon or ginger. Serve with cream or honey if desired.

Remember, tea blending is all about experimenting and finding what flavors you enjoy. Don't be afraid to mix and match ingredients to fit your taste preferences. Enjoy!
